title: Use Content Generator for REST API
content:
The Content Generator enables you to create a project containing the CloudSlang flows based on URL to Resource Listing or local API Definition files.

The Content Generator supports the following formats:

  • Swagger 1.0, 2.0, 3.0 (OpenAPI)
  • Web Application Description Language (WADL)

To start generating the content for REST API:

  1. On the OO Workflow Designer interface, click PROJECTS tab, and then click Open Content Generator  . A new window of the Content Generator displays.
  2. Click Swagger or WADL to select your API definition format.
  3. In the API DEFINITIONS area, click URL or Upload to choose the API definitions template:
    1. If you choose URL, enter the address of the Swagger or WADL Resource Listing in the Enter URL text box. Click BACK if you wish to go back to the earlier screen.
    2. If you choose Upload, browse and select a compatible file format from your local file system as listed below:
      1. Swagger: .json or .yaml 
      2. WADL: .wadl
  4. Click Get Data. The connection to the resource listing starts and may prompt for the following extra configuration details:
    1. For setting up Use Proxy Settings, fill in the following details:
      1. Host - Enter the hostname to establish connection.
      2. Port - Enter the port number of the hostname.
      3. Username - (Optional) Enter the valid username to access the host.
      4. Password - (Optional) Enter the password set up for the username.
    2. For setting up authentication, select the Use Authentication Settings, and then click the drop-down to choose from the following authentication types:
      1. Basic
        1. Username - Enter the valid username to access the host.
        2. Password - Enter the password set up for the username.
      2. Bearer
        1. Token- Enter the valid token ID assigned for the bearer.
      3. Digest
        1. Username - Enter the valid username to access the host.
        2. Password - Enter the password set up for the username.
  5. In the OPERATIONS screen, you can perform the following tasks:
    1. Rename the preloaded project name to your desired name.
    2. Type in the endpoint name to search and filter the endpoints. 
    3. Select all the listed endpoints or desired endpoints per your choice. The count of selected endpoints display for your reference.

      Clicking PATH, METHOD, DESCRIPTION will also sort the endpoints. Selecting all the endpoints after filtering will select only the filtered endpoints.

    4. Click NEXT. 
  6. In the CONFIGURATION screen, set up values for the following that you want assigned to the generated content:
    1. AUTHENTICATION
      1. Click Enable Authentication, and then click the drop-down to choose from the following authentication types:
        1. Basic
          1. Username - Enter the valid username to access the host.
          2. Password - Enter the password set up for the username.
        2. Bearer
          1. Token- Enter the valid token ID assigned for the bearer.
        3. Digest
          1. Username - Enter the valid username to access the host.
          2. Password - Enter the password set up for the username.
    2. PROXY
      1. Click Enable Proxy, and then enter the following details:
        1. Host - Enter the hostname to establish connection.
        2. Port - Enter the port number of the hostname.
      2. Click Enable Proxy Authentication, and then enter the following details:
        1. Username - A valid username to access the host.
        2. Password - A password set up for the username.
    3. REQUEST
      1. In the Character Set box, set up the character encoding to be  used for the HTTP request body.
      2. In the Request Timeout box, enter the time in seconds to set up the timeout.
      3. In the Request Headers box, define additional request headers in a key.value format.
  7. Click GENERATE. Wait for the process to finish.
  8. In the SUMMARY screen, view the list of all the listed endpoints, and then click FINISH. The generated content appears under the PROJECTS tab of the OO Workflow Designer.
